sen.j: 真神（まかみ）は、現在は絶滅してしまった日本オオカミが神格化したもの。
sen.e: Makami is deification of Japanese wolf which is now extinct.

sen.j: 真神は古来より聖獣として崇拝された。
sen.e: Makami has traditionally been worshipped as a sacred beast.

sen.j: 大和国（現在の奈良県）にある飛鳥の真神原の老狼は、大勢の人間を食べてきたため、その獰猛さから神格化され、イノシシやシカから作物を守護するものとされた。
sen.e: Having eaten many people, an old wolf living in Makaminohara of Asuka area in Yamato Province (present-day Nara Prefecture) was deified for its ferocity and worshipped as a guardian deity who would protect crops against wild boars and deer.

sen.j: 人語を理解し、人間の性質を見分ける力を有し、善人を守護し、悪人を罰するものと信仰された。
sen.e: Makami was worshipped as a deity who would understand human words, know the nature of each human being, protect the good and punish the wicked.

sen.j: また、厄除け、特に火難や盗難から守る力が強いとされ、絵馬などにも描かれてきた。
sen.e: Makami was regarded as having a strong power to protect people against evil, particularly such hardships as caused by fire and robbery, and its figure was drawn on Ema (votive horse tablet) and the like.

sen.j: しかし時代が流れ、人間が山地まで生活圏を広げると、狼は人と家畜を襲うものだという認識が広まった。
sen.e: As times passed, however, and human beings expanded their sphere of life into mountainous regions, a concept that a wolf attacks domestic animals spread.

sen.e: And it is said that the sacredness of makami has fallen into decline as the number of wolf has decreased.
